thread.title: Prosecutor: Gary van driver in fatal crash had used cocaine - Post-Tribune
thread.title_full: Prosecutor: Gary van driver in fatal crash had used cocaine - Post-Tribune

author: Carole Carlson
title: Prosecutor: Gary van driver in fatal crash had used cocaine - Post-Tribune
text:
Hancock County prosecutors say the man accused of reckless homicide in the fatal van crash near Indianapolis that killed a 6-year-old Gary boy had cocaine in his system.
They filed an additional felony charge of operating while intoxicated Wednesday against Charles Goodman, 53.
Goodman was driving a 1999 Ford Econoline van July 28 when he swerved off Interstate 70 and struck a tree. Jacob Williams, 6, was partially ejected and died from his injuries. Several other passengers were injured.
Mourners began lining up at St. Jude Family Worship Center in Gary at 9:30 a.m. Saturday for the visitation and funeral of Jacob Williams, 6, who was killed when the church van he was riding in overturned on the way to an Ohio youth conference.
In August, Goodman was charged with reckless homicide and driving on a suspended license. He's being held in the Hancock County Jail. His next court appearance is Oct. 30.
The group from the St. Jude Family Worship Center in Gary were traveling to Dayton, Ohio, for a youth conference.
Goodman and van's owner, Lois Hill, are also being sued in Lake Superior Court for wrongful death and negligence by Jacob Williams' mother, Florine Williams-Clark, of Gary.
Goodman was believed to live in Gary, but online court documents give a Chicago address for him.
